column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4 .
#Text=Discussion
#Text=It is believed that an ideal vaccine against Leishmania spp .

#Text=should have epitopes that will be recognized by APCs and will be able to trigger a T- lymphocyte effector response and maintain a long-lasting immune memory , which would be critical for protection against the parasite .
#Text=Therefore , the high-throughput search for epitopes with this potential has become one of the greatest current challenges for the rational design of vaccines .
#Text=Thus , reverse vaccinology started to be used for this purpose , and one of the strategies used is the search for immunogenic epitopes in whole Leishmania proteomes .
#Text=Epitope mapping in proteomes of parasites is much more complex than the mapping of epitopes in proteins already described as immunogenic .

#Text=In this way , the use of the integrative approach to immunoinformatics proposed by Brito , Guimaraes , Velloso , Correa-Oliveira , Ruiz , Reis and Resende was important to achieve potential epitopes in this study .

#Text=After employing the immunoinformatics methodologies , we identified MHC class I and class II ligand epitopes comprising mouse and human alleles , due to the absence of predictors comprising dog alleles .
#Text=However , based on some studies , we can verify that there are high levels of identity between MHC alleles of dogs and those of humans and mice .
#Text=For example , some loci of the MHC region II of dogs have an identity with those of humans and mice around 85 % and 79 % , respectively .
#Text=Regarding the in vivo screening of the immunoinformatics-selected peptides in the canine model , we selected asymptomatic dogs naturally infected by L. infantum ( natural reservoir ) .
#Text=Several studies have shown that dogs and humans with asymptomatic clinical forms have better reactivity with intra-dermal reaction than symptomatic individuals .

#Text=Similarly , Reis , et al. have already shown that asymptomatic dogs have a profile of circulating lymphocytes in the peripheral blood capable of conferring a degree of resistance to the disease .
#Text=When we performed the in vitro screening , the purpose was to identify potential epitopes in a huge number of peptides .

#Text=For this , we focused on the main biomarkers of protection , namely : lymphocyte proliferation after stimulation with L. infantum and IFN-γ production by subpopulations of T-lymphocytes ( CD4+ and CD8+ ) .

#Text=Currently , some markers related to protection have been studied , such as proinflammatory cytokines , production of immunoglobulins of IgG1 and IgG2 subtypes , and responsive CD4+ and CD8+ T-cells .
#Text=The biomarkers that we chose are essential to determine resistance or susceptibility to visceral leishmaniasis and they are widely demonstrated in the literature .
#Text=Our data support that some peptides were able to induce lymphoproliferation and the production of IFN-γ by T-cells in vitro .

#Text=In this regard , in many studies reporting the use of murine model and PBMC from patients with leishmaniasis , the main biomarker analyzed was IFN-γ produced after stimuli with different peptides .

#Text=After the in vitro screening , the reverse antigen screening ( RAS ) was used , a robust methodology that allows the selection of promising targets for the development of vaccines intended to trigger a strong cellular response .

#Text=Our findings demonstrate that an immunoinformatic approach increases the chance of finding peptides molecules ( epitopes ) which can trigger a cellular response in a naturally and asymptomatic infected model .

#Text=The fact that an antigen generates a cellular response classified as type IV or late hypersensitivity implies that this antigen may be able to generate immune memory and trigger a response characterized by important cytokines , such as IFN-γ and TNF-α .

#Text=When we analyzed the epitope conservancy of these peptides among the proteome of other Leishmania species , it was observed that peptide PEP17 demonstrated to be the most conserved epitope among various viscerotropic and dermatotropic Leishmania species .
#Text=Immunogenic peptides that show a high degree of conservancy with other parasites may be related to a better protection when compared to those not conserved .
#Text=In this way , peptides 17 , 30 , 33 , and 34 may be considered promising epitopes for the design of vaccines against VL .
